publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom-That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C.
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Nora Radcliffe*, Pauline McNeill*
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom-That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Tricia Marwick*

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom-That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion*
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Robin Harper*
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Mr Jamie Stone*, Nick Johnston*

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom—That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Dr Richard Simpson*

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom—That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston, Dr Richard Simpson
S1M-1411 Nations in Bloom (lodged on 30 November 2000) Karen Whitefield*

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom—That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston, Dr Richard Simpson, Karen Whitefield

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom—That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston, Dr Richard Simpson, Karen Whitefield

S1M-1411 Scott Barrie: Nations in Bloom—That the Parliament notes that the village of Culross in the Dunfermline West constituency, is one of only two Scottish finalists in the Nations in Bloom 2000 competition; congratulates the villagers, the community council and Fife Council for their environmental work and wishes them well in their endeavour to secure the "Under 10,000 Population" category title at the world finals in Washington D.C. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Mr Keith Harding, Tricia Marwick, Mr John McAllion, Mr Keith Raffan, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston, Dr Richard Simpson, Karen Whitefield
